title: ‘Now I sell by myself and make tons more money’: Friends try to hijack a homemade ice cream business by eating the inventory, inviting freeloaders, and cutting out the owner, forcing the real entrepreneur to take everything and leave
description: A homegrown business venture can be a great way for one to separate true friends from freeloaders with sticky fingers and grand designs on charity. Our snack mogul starts off with the simple dream of slinging homemade ice cream and drinks to a grateful populace, only to discover that friendship and capitalism mix about as well as pickles and vanilla. The first week brings riches and camaraderie; the second week, a coup led by a ragtag band of opportunists with big appetites and even bigger ideas about profit-sharing, none of which include the person actually supplying the inventory.
author: Etai Eshet
excerpt: ‘Now I sell by myself and make tons more money’: Friends try to hijack a homemade ice cream business by eating the inventory, inviting freeloaders, and cutting out the owner, forcing the real entrepreneur to take everything and leave - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
text: Things go downhill fast. New members are ushered in without consent, snacks vanish into the void, and suddenly the owner’s cut shrinks to match their patience. Friends turn into rivals with the nutritional habits of raccoons and the ethics to match, treating the original entrepreneur like a guest at their own party. When polite confrontation gets ignored and the bottom line drops into the red, our business owner takes decisive action: pack up the operation, wave goodbye to the leeches, and reclaim every last frozen treat. The soundtrack to this move is a chorus of pleas from suddenly desperate ex-friends who prefer their good deeds funded by someone else’s debt.
